key_findings: "ERDs define three core components: Entities (tables), Attributes (columns), and Relationships (how tables connect), along with their cardinality (e.g., one-to-many).",
"description": "Example: Basic DDL for a simple Customer-Order ERD",

"code": "-- Entity: Customers
CREATE TABLE Customers (
    customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT,
    first_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    last_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    phone_number VARCHAR(20),
    address VARCHAR(255),
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- Entity: Products
CREATE TABLE Products (
    product_id INT PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT,
    product_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    description TEXT,
    price DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL,
    stock_quantity INT NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
    created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);

-- Entity: Orders (linking Customers and Products via OrderItems)
CREATE TABLE Orders (
    order_id INT PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT,
    customer_id INT NOT NULL,
    order_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
    total_amount DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL,
    status VARCHAR(50) DEFAULT 'Pending',
    FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES Customers(customer_id)
);

-- Entity: OrderItems (Many-to-Many relationship between Orders and Products)
CREATE TABLE OrderItems (
    order_item_id INT PRIMARY KEY AUTO_INCREMENT,
    order_id INT NOT NULL,
    product_id INT NOT NULL,
    quantity INT NOT NULL,
    unit_price DECIMAL(10, 2) NOT NULL,
    FOREIGN KEY (order_id) REFERENCES Orders(order_id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    FOREIGN KEY (product_id) REFERENCES Products(product_id),
    UNIQUE (order_id, product_id) -- Ensures a product is only listed once per order item
);"

"**Consistent Naming Conventions:** Use singular, descriptive names for entities (e.g., `Customer` not `Customers`) and clear, snake_case or camelCase for attributes (e.g., `first_name`, `orderDate`).",

"**Appropriate Normalization:** Aim for 3rd Normal Form (3NF) to minimize data redundancy and improve integrity. Understand when to strategically denormalize for performance in read-heavy scenarios.",
